p: The notion of inducing CHIKV-specific memory T cells as mediators of protection is attractive as T cell epitopes are generally better conserved than B cell antigens, mitigating the risk of immune escape through antigenic variations ( 66– 69). Of the memory T cells, tissue-resident memory T cells (TRMs) are a unique subset of cells that is distinct from conventional memory T cells, in that the former dwell at the peripheral organs ( 70– 73). The latter either reside in the lymphoid organs (central memory T cells) or recirculate in the body (effector memory T cells) ( 74, 75). Thus, TRMs could function as adaptive immune cells that act as first-line responders at the site of infection ( 71, 73, 76). Putative CHIKV-specific skin TRMs can be well-positioned to react to CHIKV-infected cells at the feeding site by virus-infected mosquitos during a blood meal.
